intro: Jatropha jaimejimenezii, commonly known as the Jaime Jimenez's jatropha, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are a defense mechanism against herbivores. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
